‘My father said to some friend...’
‘Give (one) to Josh, too!’
‘You are my maternal uncle.’ (lit.: you are maternal uncle to me)

‘I loosen the stomach from the liver.’

‘I will ask Edgar.’
‘I have a headache.’ (lit.: ‘I am from head’)

example.original: mån iv tuhtje dav färska málest
example.translation: ‘I don’t like that (made) of fresh blood.’

‘The Saami keep the reindeer there in the summer.’
‘One puts out fishing nets in the evening.’
‘I give food to three reindeer.’
‘I give gloves to you.’
‘There is sorrel in the mountains, too.’ (lit.: there are sorrels...)
‘There isn’t a single tjårvebielle now.’

example.original: motora vadnasij motora ij gävdnu sáme gielan
example.detailedTranslation: motor/gen.sg boatcom.pl “motor” neg/3sg.prs exist/conneg Saami/gen.sg languageiness.sg
example.translation: ‘...with motor boats. There is no (word for) “motor” in the Saami language.’
‘Matthias was my maternal uncle.’
‘I am a Saami.’

example.original: buhtsoj lä nav buojde ja tjábbe
example.detailedTranslation: reindeer/nom.pl be/3pl.prs so fat/pl and beautiful/pl
example.translation: ‘The reindeer are so fat and beautiful.’
‘We two were in Fuordnak.’
‘And this is also (made) of cloth.’
‘And now it’s coffee (time).’
‘I have one child.’
‘And then we had cows.’
‘You all may drink water from that.’

example.original: ja dä del virrtin allget bäbbmat
example.detailedTranslation: and then well must3pl.pst begininf feedinf
example.translation: ‘And then they had to start to feed (the reindeer).’
‘We can speak the Pite Saami language.’
‘I want to have fish.’

example.original: dä ij del almatj sida nagin sadjáj vuällget
example.detailedTranslation: then neg3sg.prs obviously person/nom.sg want/conneg some placeill.sg goinf
example.translation: ‘Then one obviously doesn’t want to go anywhere.’
‘Then I will tell (you) a memory.’

example.original: jo da lä akta vuoberis gallga giesset ulgus
example.detailedTranslation: yes then be/3sg.prs one buck/nom.sg will/3sg.prs pullinf out
example.translation: ‘Yes, it’s a 3-year old reindeer buck, (he) will pull (it) out.’ Specifically, a vuoberis is a three-year-old reindeer buck, but the gloss has been shortened to save space.
‘We will get that book.’

example.original: jus galga sáme viesov valldet dä galga mielagav dal navt rutastit
example.detailedTranslation: if will/3sg.prs Saami/gen.sg lifeacc.sg takeinf then will/3sg.prs sternumacc.sg then so pullinf
example.translation: ‘If I choose Saami style, then I will pull the sternum like this.’
‘I was born there.’

example.original: lä dån mannam nagin bále ja tjuvvum Vistegij
example.detailedTranslation: be/2sg.prs 2sg.nom goprf some time/gen.sg and accompanyprf Vistekill.sg
example.translation: ‘Have you ever gone and accompanied (them) to Vistek?’

example.original: men mån lev tjåjvev ruhtastemin ullgus
example.translation: ‘But I’m cutting out the stomach.’
‘Well, what is he studying?’ (lit.: reading)
‘I don’t believe so.’
‘There wasn’t any butter to buy at all.’

example.original: men ijtjin del bårå dan sisste
example.detailedTranslation: but neg3pl.pst then eat/conneg demdistgen.sg out
example.translation: ‘But they didn’t eat out of this.’

example.original: ij vanj dä máhte ilá stuor dålåv adnet
example.detailedTranslation: neg/3sg.prs well then can/conneg too big fireacc.sg haveinf
example.translation: ‘But you can’t have too big of a fire.’

example.original: dä iv lä åbbå gullam dav
example.detailedTranslation: then neg1sg.prs be/conneg at.all hearprf demdistacc.sg
example.translation: ‘I haven’t heard that at all.’

example.original: nej mån iv lä bårråm men Jåssjå=l bårråm
example.detailedTranslation: no 1sg.nom neg1sg.prs be/conneg eatprf but Josh/nom.sg=be/3sg.prs eatprf
example.translation: ‘No, I haven’t eaten (it), but Josh has eaten (it).’
‘What are you saying?’
‘What then did you help (with)?’
‘Who did you go with?’
‘How long do you have those in the smoke hole for?’
‘How is it?’
‘Where are you coming from?’
‘Where did you pick those?’

example.original: nå gukte lij Áhkabákten gu dånnå lidje mánná
example.detailedTranslation: well how be3sg.pst Áhkkabákkteiness.sg when 2sg.nom be/2sg.pst child/nom.sg
example.translation: ‘Well what was Áhkkabákkte like when you were a child?’
‘Are you going to say more?’
‘Do you smoke?’

example.original: lij sån uktu jala lij Halvar aj maŋŋen
example.detailedTranslation: be3sg.pst 3sg.nom alone or be3sg.pst Halvar/nom.sg also along
example.translation: ‘Was he alone or was Halvar also along?’
‘Were you allowed to speak Saami there?’
‘Have you ever drunk goat’s milk?’
‘Have you eaten meat there?’
‘Say something about this Låddávvre!’
‘Put the potato on the table!’
‘Thank you (two)!’ (lit.: have thanks!)
‘Go to sleep now!’
‘Well then I say we really should probably go.’
‘Oh no, I’ll probably have to take off some clothes.’
‘If he will perhaps make coffee.’
‘Perhaps you could make some coffee.’

example.original: men ijtjin del bårå dan siste men ednen biebmojd biergojd ja dále návte deggara sinne
example.detailedTranslation: but neg3pl.pst obviously eat/conneg demdistgen.sg out but have3pl.pst foodacc.pl meatacc.pl and now like.this such/gen.pl in
example.translation: ‘But they obviously didn’t eat out of that, but they had food, meat and so on in such things.’

example.original: dále=l gámbal dåhpe jala almatj hållå unna dåbátj
example.detailedTranslation: now=be/3sg.prs old house/nom.sg or person/nom.sg say/3sg.prs small housedim/nom.sg
example.translation: ‘Now this is the old house, or one says “the little house”.’

example.original: ja dä mån hålåv att sidav bajket
example.detailedTranslation: and then 1sg.nom say1sg.prs subord want1sg.prs poopinf
example.translation: ‘And then I say that I want to poop.’

example.original: men mån diedav att háre lä jávren
example.detailedTranslation: but 1sg.nom know1sg.prs subord greyling/nom.pl be/3pl.prs lakeiness.sg
example.translation: ‘But I know that there are greyling in the lake.’

example.original: mån jáhkav stuor tjuovtja lä danne
example.translation: ‘I believe there are big whitefish there.’

example.original: men mån tuhtjiv dat lij nav suohtas tieltajn viessot
example.detailedTranslation: but 1sg.nom think1sg.prs demdistnom.sg be/3sg.pst so nice tentiness.pl liveinf
example.translation: ‘But I think it was so nice to stay in tents.’
‘But then I say we shot a moose.’

example.original: mån iv diede gåsse gillgin gávnadit maŋep bále
example.detailedTranslation: 1sg.nom neg1sg.prs know/conneg when will1du.prs meetinf aftercomp time/gen.sg
example.translation: ‘I don’t know when we’ll meet next time.’

example.original: mån iv skene mav dån hålå
example.translation: ‘I don’t understand what you’re saying.’
‘I know who she is.’

example.original: man mälgat lij gu lij hiejman iv mån diede
example.detailedTranslation: how far be3sg.pst when be3sg.pst homeiness.sg neg1sg.prs 1sg.nom know/conneg
example.translation: ‘I don’t know how far it was to get home.’

example.original: nå gosse dijá älgijdä Örnvikast vuodjet vadnásav
example.detailedTranslation: well when 2pl.nom begin2pl.pst Örnvikelat.sg driveinf boatacc.sg
example.translation: ‘Well when did you start to take the boat from Örnvik?’

example.original: ja dä del virrtin allget biebmat fodderijd vuodjet
example.detailedTranslation: and then obviously must3pl.pst begininf feedinf feedacc.pl driveinf
example.translation: ‘And so they obviously had to start to feed, to transport the feed.’

example.original: nä mån liv åjaldahtam valldet maŋen
example.translation: ‘No, I forgot to take it along.’
‘I am forgetting to say, when I did the perch...’

example.original: hihtu vanj dä baktjat innan mån stärtiv motorav
example.detailedTranslation: must/2sg.prs well then backinf before 1sg.nom start1sg.prs motoracc.sg
example.translation: ‘Well you have to back up then before I start the motor.’

example.original: gu lidjin sladjim dä båhtin da bajás
example.detailedTranslation: when be3pl.pst harvestprf then come3pl.pst demdist/sg.nom up
example.translation: ‘Once (the farmers) had harvested, then they (the plants) came up.’
‘I write while listening.’

example.original: dä inijmä aktav vuoksav majna vuojadijmä muorajd
example.detailedTranslation: then have1pl.pst oneacc.sg bullacc.sg relcom.sg drive1pl.pst woodacc.pl
example.translation: ‘We had one bull with which we transported firewood.’

example.original: ja dä maŋŋemus skoterijd majd iniga
example.detailedTranslation: and then aftersuperl snowmobileacc.pl relacc.pl have3du.pst
example.translation: ‘...and the last snowmobiles which they had.’

example.original: dä lä ájge ma lä urrum
example.detailedTranslation: then be/3pl.prs time/nom.pl rel/nom.pl be/3pl.prs beprf
example.translation: ‘Those are times which have been.’ (i.e.: ‘those were the good old days’)
‘We two who had come.’

example.original: dä lin nuora álmatja ma lin riejdnohimen
example.detailedTranslation: then be3pl.pst young/pred.pl peoplenom.pl rel/nom.pl be3pl.pst herdprog
example.translation: ‘They were young people who were herding.’

example.original: dat lij duv gugu masa båhten
example.translation: ‘It was to you they came.’

example.original: dat lä náhppe man sisa båhtjen buhtsujd
example.detailedTranslation: demdistnom.sg be/3sg.prs milking.bowl/nom.sg relgen.sg into milk3pl.pst reindeeracc.pl
example.translation: ‘This is a milking bowl into which they milked reindeer.’

example.original: men dä lä danne urrum dat pluovve man namma lä mij lä namma dan dáv mijá Árjepluovev
example.detailedTranslation: but then be/3sg.prs there beprf demdistnom.sg pond/nom.sg relgen.sg name/nom.sg be/3sg.prs rel/nom.sg be/3sg.prs name/nom.sg demdistgen.sg demproxacc.sg 1pl.gen Arjeplogacc.sg
example.translation: ‘But here was the pond whose name was, which was the name of that, this, our Arjeplog.’
